wikipedia_page.main: John Barry Dyson (6 September 1942 – 26 February 1995; better known as Barry Dyson) was an English association footballer who played as a centre forward. He played in the Football League for Bury, Tranmere Rovers, Crystal Palace, Watford, Orient and Colchester United, as well as a brief spell on loan at non-league Chelmsford City.

response: * John Barry Dyson (1942–1995), English association footballer for several Football League clubs including Tranmere Rovers and Watford
*Barry Dyson, 52, English football player, heart attack.
